User provide high-level research directi.Format: Research objective stated in introduction and abstract
User provide high-level research directi.Example: Discovery of novel and promising catalyst materials, specifically for 2e-ORR
User provide high-level research directi.Role in workflow: Defines the focus for generative model development and catalyst discovery

User provide structured, domain-specific.Format: Rules for binary alloy composition and adsorption site for 2e-ORR catalysts
User provide structured, domain-specific.Example: Binary alloys must consist of oxophilic and oxophobic elements; active sites must be ontop of oxophilic atoms
User provide structured, domain-specific.Role in workflow: Constrains fine-tuning and evaluation of generated catalysts

User provide datasets other than researc.Format: Publicly available catalyst structure datasets (OC20-S2EF, 2e-ORR dataset)
User provide datasets other than researc.Role in workflow: Used for model training, validation, and fine-tuning

User provide representations or formal i.Format: String representations of catalyst structures (lattice parameters, atomic symbols, coordinates)
User provide representations or formal i.Example: C = (l1, l2, l3, θ1, θ2, θ3, e1, x1, y1, z1, …, eN, xN, yN, zN)
User provide representations or formal i.Role in workflow: Input format for generative model and anomaly detection

Structural or Entity Decomposition.Method details: Structures are decomposed into lattice parameters, atomic symbols, and coordinates for tokenization
Structural or Entity Decomposition.Outputs: Tokenized sequences representing each atom and its properties
Structural or Entity Decomposition.Example: Bulk, surface, and adsorbate atoms are identified and ordered
Structural or Entity Decomposition.Role in workflow: Enables sequential generation and evaluation of catalyst structures

Molecular or Chemical Embedding.Method details: CrystalNN and Magpie fingerprints are used to convert structures and compositions into vectors
Molecular or Chemical Embedding.Outputs: Vector representations for similarity and coverage analysis
Molecular or Chemical Embedding.Example: Coverage and property distribution metrics use these embeddings
Molecular or Chemical Embedding.Role in workflow: Quantifies similarity and diversity of generated catalysts

Pattern and Feature Extraction.Method details: Anomaly detection model extracts features indicating incompletion or scale mismatch from string representations
Pattern and Feature Extraction.Example: BERT-based model trained on corrupted and valid data
Pattern and Feature Extraction.Role in workflow: Filters out structurally or chemically invalid generations

Property and Annotation Extraction.Method details: Density and number of unique elements are extracted for property distribution analysis
Property and Annotation Extraction.Example: Earth Mover’s Distance (EMD) calculated for density and element count
Property and Annotation Extraction.Role in workflow: Assesses how well generated data matches real catalyst properties

Sequence and Structure Feature Extractio.Method details: Order of atoms (bulk, surface, adsorbate) is preserved and used as a feature in generation
Sequence and Structure Feature Extractio.Example: Atom ordering affects end-of-sequence prediction in the model
Sequence and Structure Feature Extractio.Role in workflow: Improves model’s ability to generate realistic structures

Domain-Specific Data Retrieval and Reaso.Method details: OC20-S2EF and 2e-ORR datasets are directly accessed and used for model training and validation
Domain-Specific Data Retrieval and Reaso.Outputs: Training, validation, and fine-tuning data for models
Domain-Specific Data Retrieval and Reaso.Example: OC20 dataset downloaded from public repository
Domain-Specific Data Retrieval and Reaso.Role in workflow: Provides large-scale, domain-relevant data for generative modeling

Data Retrieval via Domain-Specific Repos.Method details: OC20 and 2e-ORR datasets are obtained from domain repositories (links provided)
Data Retrieval via Domain-Specific Repos.Role in workflow: Ensures reproducibility and access to high-quality data

Library Assembly and Data Augmentation.Method details: Data augmentation via translation, rotation, and permutation of atomic coordinates
Library Assembly and Data Augmentation.Example: 33% translated, 33% rotated, 33% unchanged; permutation dataset for atom order

Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Method details: GPT-2-based CatGPT model trained to generate catalyst structures as text sequences
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Example: CatGPT generates 10,000 new catalyst structures from <bos> token
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Role in workflow: Proposes new catalyst structures for downstream evaluation

Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Method details: Anomaly detection model identifies invalid patterns (incompletion, scale mismatch) in generated structures
Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Outputs: Filtered set of valid candidate structures
Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Example: BERT-based classifier removes incomplete or mismatched structures
Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Role in workflow: Ensures only plausible hypotheses (structures) are considered

Idea/hypothesis generation via Feature-D.Method details: MLP and DFT calculations predict binding energies and selectivity/activity descriptors for generated catalysts
Idea/hypothesis generation via Feature-D.Example: EquiformerV2 MLP predicts binding energies for screening
Idea/hypothesis generation via Feature-D.Role in workflow: Informs which generated structures are likely to be active/selective catalysts

Idea/hypothesis generation after Fine-Tu.Method details: CatGPT is fine-tuned on a small, biased 2e-ORR dataset to generate catalysts with desired properties
Idea/hypothesis generation after Fine-Tu.Example: Fine-tuned model generates binary alloy catalysts for H2O2 production
Idea/hypothesis generation after Fine-Tu.Role in workflow: Focuses generative process on a specific catalytic task

LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Method details: Generated catalysts are evaluated for composition and adsorption validity based on domain rules
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Outputs: Scores for composition and adsorption validity
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Example: Structures must have oxophilic/oxophobic composition and correct adsorption site
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Role in workflow: Filters candidates to those matching domain-specific requirements

LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Method details: Metrics such as generation validity, structural validity, catalyst validity, coverage, and property distribution are computed
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Outputs: Quantitative scores for validity and similarity
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Example: Anomaly detection model, EMD for property distribution
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Role in workflow: Assesses quality and realism of generated hypotheses

Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Novelty C.Method details: Novelty is assessed by checking if generated structures exist in the training set using StructureMatcher
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Novelty C.Outputs: Novelty score (proportion not in training set)

Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Quantitat.Method details: Binding energies and selectivity/activity descriptors are quantitatively evaluated using MLP and DFT
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Quantitat.Outputs: ΔGOOH* and ΔGO* values for activity/selectivity
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Quantitat.Example: DFT confirms 10 structures meet activity/selectivity criteria
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Quantitat.Role in workflow: Objectively ranks candidates for experimental relevance

Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Method details: MLP (EquiformerV2) and DFT calculations are used to optimize structures and compute binding energies
Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Example: 35 structures screened by MLP, 10 validated by DFT
Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Role in workflow: Validates activity/selectivity of generated catalysts computationally

Refinement via Automated Quality Evaluat.Method details: Anomaly detection model (BERT) and structural validity checks filter invalid generations
Refinement via Automated Quality Evaluat.Example: Structures with incompletion or scale mismatch are removed
Refinement via Automated Quality Evaluat.Role in workflow: Ensures only valid structures proceed to further evaluation

Refinement via guided by computational-d.Method details: Screening and selection of candidates is based on computational results (MLP/DFT binding energies)
Refinement via guided by computational-d.Inputs: Predicted binding energies and validity scores
Refinement via guided by computational-d.Example: Only structures meeting activity/selectivity criteria are retained
Refinement via guided by computational-d.Role in workflow: Focuses resources on most promising candidates

Refinement via Performance-metric.Method details: Performance metrics (activity/selectivity windows) guide which structures are selected after computational testing
Refinement via Performance-metric.Outputs: Subset of structures within optimal performance range
Refinement via Performance-metric.Example: 5 structures with ΔGOOH* in 4.22 ± 0.2 eV range
Refinement via Performance-metric.Role in workflow: Ensures only high-performing catalysts are proposed

paper_title: Generative Language Model for Catalyst Discovery
